website_summaries.verdict: For the money, the Canon EOS Rebel T3i is a great choice for dSLR videographers--though the cheaper T2i can still suffice if you don't need the articulated LCD--and it's a solid choice for creative still shooters. But though the image quality and general shooting performance are top-notch, if you're upgrading to capture sports, kids, or pets, the T3i may not be able to keep up.
pros: The Canon EOS Rebel T3i delivers excellent video capabilities and image and video quality
cons: If you shoot both still and video, the T3i's controls can be frustrating to operate, and it's not terribly fast for burst shooting  sports, kids, or pets

customer_reviews.title: This camera takes some amazing quality photos as well as some amazing video
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes some amazing quality photos as well as some amazing video! I was skeptical about it but I am surely happy with my purchase because it is lightweight enough to be a vlogging camera but also makes it look like I mean business when I'm recording a video for my youtube channel! another plus would be the flip screen! I had to have it once I saw that it was a flip screen AND that screen just so happens to be a touch screen! also the best customer service I've ever got on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: DominicSilverio

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, takes great pictures, minimal skill required
customer_reviews.text: We have really enjoyed this camera! We have close to no knowledge of photography, but we got this camera as a gift before our first child was born. With a little experimentation, we have learned to take some great pictures! We took newborn pictures that rivaled some of our friend's professionally done pictures. I even had people asking who took the pictures! The controls are easy to use and understand. The battery rarely needs to be charged. We can tell a big difference in quality between the pictures taken with our camera vs. the pictures we take with our phone. I'm really glad that we have this camera for special life events and family pictures.
customer_reviews.author: LMB

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for both photo and video!
customer_reviews.text: This has been my go-to camera for years and still my favorite! The only real downside is in the video capture is great, the audio recording is poop. I use this for web videos and I added a Tascam dr05, an SG-108 mini shotgun mic and connected them with a  and bingo. A simple semi-pro video rig. a brilliant still photo camera. Even after upgrading to a Sony Pxw-fs5, I still use this in film production. From everyday user to the prosumer, still a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Need an Affordable DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I needed a little DSLR which shoots video and this was the right price. It is NOT top of the line, and the picture quality is not as nice as I had hoped, but it is serviceable for those low-end video jobs for which I needed it. The menus are clunky, the flip out monitor is not great. If you can afford to move up to a higher pixel rate, you'll be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Throckmorton

customer_reviews.title: Great camera design!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this camera several years ago! It was great then. I didn’t get to enjoy it much because I snapped off the LCD screen when I tripped over my tripod. Please make sure you close it you’re not using it. If it snaps off you’re screwed. :( such an expensive repair and it doesn’t function well without it. I wouldn’t buy this camera in 2020. There are so many better ones now and technology is so cutting edge. I still use a rebel just a more recent one. I love the design, the flip out screen is great for vlogging and for people like me who always have to film everything by themselves.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Love !
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using this camera for the past 5+ years for youtube and photography and I love it so much!!
customer_reviews.author: June

customer_reviews.title: Was Happy With Mine
customer_reviews.text: Outdated now, but a great camera for a beginner if you can get a good deal on it. Remember, camera bodies go obsolete left and right, often within only a few months. Lenses retain their value much better, and can even increase in value in some (rare) cases. Invest in some good glass (I stuck L glass on this one) and you'll be able to get much better photos with a cheap camera than with a high end body that has mediocre lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Batman_Bin_SuparmanTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: An Amazing Beginner Camera
customer_reviews.text: I had previous experience with a D3200 but it had been a few years since I touched a camera. After playing with it for a day I was back on track and shooting video. While this is a great beginner camera, there are a lot of settings that you'll want to spend some time looking up. We used this in my Single Cam class in College for recreating movie scenes and the quality was nearly the same on this camera as it was from the actual movie.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases I've ever made
customer_reviews.text: This camera gave me the first semi-professional tools I needed to experiment with photography and video. I've never looked back.
customer_reviews.author: S. Shanafelt

customer_reviews.title: High quality camera, a bit complicated to operate
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my father as he wanted a good camera to take pictures of my young siblings. He didn't want a point and shoot camera. However, this camera is very complicated to operate and you do have to read the manual to understand all the functions. Lucky for us, the instructions came in several languages as my dad only speaks Spanish! Great picture quality even though it is a bit complex for the average person.
customer_reviews.author: MV

customer_reviews.title: Value, Versatile, Quality, and good for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: This is beyond my favorite camera i own or have ever owned. I got this several years ago when i was still learning about photography. I learned fairly quickly as this camera is very user friendly. I use this to capture images of my artwork, stop motion, short films, youtube videos, product shots, and travel shots. It versatile and a great value for the price. If you're starting out, i defiantly recommend the canon EOS T3i
customer_reviews.author: KittyLovesTofu

customer_reviews.title: My first DSLR, pretty easy to use
customer_reviews.text: After the very first picture, I looked at the display screen and said "Holy crap, I'm Ansel freaking Adams!". If you're a newb DSLRs like me, I think you'll like this camera. I can't comment on all the advanced features, as I don't know too much about photography, but I found the controls to be fairly intuitive (not perfect!) and it gives me control over aperture, exposure, and other things that I don't know what they mean. I've taken some great photos with this camera, including action shots, shots out of a car doing 70 MPH, and some astrophotography, with good results.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Oh man, I love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before buying this camera and I am not disappointed. It was on sale on Amazon for $499 with the stock lens, excellent price! I was considering getting the T5i for the touch screen, but I believe using the buttons with practice will be just as fast if not faster, kind of like key commands versus the mouse. Other than that the other upgraded features don't make a difference to me. The $200 extra seemed too much just for that. I am an amateur videographer, when I'm a pro I'll get the 5D, I can deal with not having a touch screen till then.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: It came in beautiful condition. Pros: The screen on the back flips in to protect it or out for viewing There are many pre-sets and a few manual The video works nicely Comes with a quality neck strap Cons: I want a lens that can get more close ups when filming on a dance floor (I guess that's on my wishlist) The flash isn't removable (another wishlist item) Sometimes the video I've taken has glitches Wonderful camera for the price. I will upgrade eventually, however this works for my current budget and needs. Beautiful pictures and such.
customer_reviews.author: KristyLynne

customer_reviews.title: Wife's new camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife for her birthday. She likes to take pictures of birds and was not getting the quality shots with the simpler cameras, this one with the 55-200 IS lens has been perfect. Very easy to use and pictures are outstanding. I used it myself for the first time a couple of weekends ago, and being someone who has never taken many pictures was able to get some wonderful action pics of an inline marathon. Can't say how it compares to other cameras in this range, but for an inexperienced person looking to upgrade and get some better shots I would definetly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: mikeo

customer_reviews.title: An intuitive, sophisticated digital camera for a decent price (relative to other digital cameras).
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift. I gave it to the recipient on Thanksgiving so she could acclimate herself with it by Christmas. She opened it, and almost immediately starting taking pictures. Of course, she switched the the camera to the automatic settings as soon as she opened it. So I am a little worried that I spent a bunch of money on a relatively sophisticated camera when the recipient will only utilize about 15% of its potential. I decided to buy her beginners book on digital photography written specifically for this camera. But I still fear I'm just throwing good money after bad. Ultimately, though, it seems like a find digital camera.
customer_reviews.author: Son Of A Gunderson

customer_reviews.title: One word: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a local videographer and photojournalist for a small paper. Previously having a consumer Nikon Superzoom and a Panasonic video camera, this not only replaced both, but completely blew them away. Shooting photos is extremely responsive, and for those that just want an auto setting, it does an amazing job! I'm a manual-settings freak, and this is why I chose this camera. The 1080P is stunning, and is COMPLETELY MANUAL! If you're looking for an auto-focus video cam, this is not it. This is really geared for pro-sumers, artists, professionals... It is EXACTLY what my business needed, it was a super upgrade for us!
customer_reviews.author: DenDen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Have had several issues with the shutter mechanism getting stuck, have sent it to Canon for repairs. About 3 months after Canon sending me the camera back, the same issue with shutter occurred. Of course both time this issue occurred, I was at a tournament for my daughter. So can't get those moments back. I have had canon's for 30 years, just goes to show a bad experience can lose you a customer. Even though I have bought several canon lenses to go with the camera, I am looking at alternatives not made by Canon. Will probably go with a Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Nishibayashi

customer_reviews.title: Canon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera so I can learn more about manual mode. I tested out the features so far so good 😍 I'll post pictures as soon as I take it out... I'm so excited
customer_reviews.author: Crissy

customer_reviews.title: As a very novice photographer I can't go into great detail about the tech specs
customer_reviews.text: As a very novice photographer I can't go into great detail about the tech specs, etc of this camera, but I will say that I love using it and it takes stunning photos. Coming from a basic point and shoot, I will say I still have tons to learn about all this camera can do, but at the same time I don't feel overwhelmed by it. The shots are also lightning fast compared to what I am used to, so this really helps me not miss the intended shots of my kids.
customer_reviews.author: T.White

customer_reviews.title: Love this Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I had the Canon 450D for a few years, but was so impressed with a friend's photos that were taken with the T3i that I had to upgrade, and am so glad I did. I didnt even know what I was missing with the amazing definition video!! Last week I went to my children's school concerts/plays and used this camera to zoom in (with my zoom lens) and was able to make amazing, crisp, clear video. These kinds of photos and videos are priceless, especially when you have kids! It captures every tiny detail. Amazing!! Would highly recommend, and look forward to using this for travel.
customer_reviews.author: MBrooks425

customer_reviews.title: What's not to love?
customer_reviews.text: I'm a blogger and this camera came highly recommended by all the pro bloggers. Now I know why. I love the video and picture quality. I'm in no way an expert photographer so I totally expected to have a huge learning curve with using this but it was super easy. I recommend reading through the manuals for it though just so you know how to properly use it (If you're new like me) because there's definitely a way to take care of it properly and you can easily damage it. THis is my new favorite toy.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Williams

customer_reviews.title: Simply a short evaluation because its a gift
customer_reviews.text: Although this is a Christmas gift for a family member I wanted to put it through some of the most basic functions and have a good feeling that there would be no surprises on Christmas morning. Based on my own T2i there was little learning curve although the menus have changed some (to be expected). The camera preformed flawlessly for me and left me extremely pleased. No, I didn't give it a 5 star rating simply because a couple hours shooting is hardly enough evaluation. I've never been disappointed with Canon products and I trust it will continue here with this one once this gift is received and more importantly put to use.
customer_reviews.author: Doug W

customer_reviews.title: I recommend
customer_reviews.text: I’ve have had this camera for a couple years now and it is still working like a well old machine. I’ve had no problems with this camera and the quality while shooting clips are amazing. If you can’t afford the latest camera I recommend this one. Also the viewfinder definitely helps .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had to exchange one, but the replacement one is great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to upgrade from an older digital Rebel without video capability. I received this camera with a stain or smudge on the sensor that created blurry spots on photos. As it was on the sensor itself it wouldn't show up on screen during a preview or through the viewfinder, and it was small enough to be hard to spot when viewing photos on the camera, but when viewed on a larger screen the spot was very noticeable. I didn't want to risk damaging the sensor by trying to clean it, so I returned it for an exchange. The second one had no problems and performs very well.
customer_reviews.author: PaulHa

customer_reviews.title: Amazing picture clarity, and lots of shooting modes.
customer_reviews.text: This is our first DSLR camera. It was a purchase in anticipation of our first child. We've used it plenty and the pictures are amazingly clear. With all the different modes we've been able to take some pretty cool pictures. The motion setting is great for kids always on the move. We haven't used it for video, so I cannot comment on that, but for a novice it's an amazing camera. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: K. McShane

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I'm definitely not a pro, so won't be able to give you an in debt review of this camera. I've had my T3i for about a month now. Love it so far, it's my first DSLR so I'm still learning and experimenting. I think it's a great entry level DSLR. The pictures and videos I've taken came out great, I'm sure they'll be a lot better once I learn and get a better hang of this camera. Great quality and ease of use. If you put in a little time of exploring the menus it's really is not that difficult to learn. I've been watching a lot of you tube tutorials etc, very helpful!
customer_reviews.author: D. mekertichyan

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I am an amateur photographer, who uses my camera mainly for taking unusual and/or beautiful shots of nature; both at our home in the forest, as well as our 2nd home on a large lake. I am not mechanical, so when I pulled my camera out of the box I thought I had made a mistake and would never learn to use it. Wrong! I haven't had it very long but am already taking magazine quality shots. The stabilizer is great, especially when on a moving boat taking shots of your grandkids tubing behind! I love this camera and have no complaints. If I can take great shots with it then anyone can.
customer_reviews.author: Astara

customer_reviews.title: A lot of camera
customer_reviews.text: First of all I have only had this camera for a few days. It has a lot of features I have not used yet, but so far I really like it. Be prepared to read the 300+ page instructions book. Which by the way is entirely too small to read, for me anyway. I had better luck downloading the PDF File and reading it. But don't let all the complex features scare you away. All you have to do it pop in a battery and SD Card (not included), set the camera to 'Auto' and shoot away. Great Pictures...
customer_reviews.author: L. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: 2013 Hoilday Best Buy
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful camera that works well for experts as well as beginners. Photos are as good as other DSLR's out there. My friends TI5 looks identical. The photos from comparing these two cameras are impossible to tell apart. The TI5 is supposed to be better in low light but while testing them we could see no advantages. Like all DSLRs, it's all about the lens. Buy this model and use the money you save for better glass. This camera with a good lens will blow the socks off the newer models with the standard lens.
customer_reviews.author: A K Q 10 2

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic DSLR Camera
customer_reviews.text: This Canon camera can do more than you will ever even think of using. If one is available, you should get a T3i for Dummies book so you could learn all the features. That said, it takes a great photo and outstanding video clips. Of course it helps to have a really good lens mounted to allow the camera's features to shine! You may spend as much on a good lens as the camera cost, but it will be worth it. O, by the way, I have never "loved" any non-human thing-five stars; so saying 'I liked it', four stars, means it is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ITS BLURRY
customer_reviews.text: I just received my order pretty fast and i love the camera and its working but its not .. its blurry and i have tried everything to fix it but its not working if i cant fix it i will be returning it
customer_reviews.author: Jordayn thomas

customer_reviews.title: great!
customer_reviews.text: I will start by saying I am not a photographer. I bought this camera for my husband, so that he could take good pictures of our kids instead of being limited by his point-and-shoot. I decided on this model after reading the other reviews, and I am glad that I did. My husband loves this camera, and is experimenting with all the different modes and features. This is a good camera for those who aren't professional photographers but still want a better picture.
customer_reviews.author: DHM

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to celebrate the birth of my first son. I wanted to make sure I had a great camera and video camera to capture all of the fun years as he grows up. The mix of camera and video camera works great. Both the photos and the video are very crisp. The detachable and swivel screen works well as well. It allows for some awkward angles and self photos. I replaced and older rebel with this camera and was very happy. Also make sure you buy a large memory card (I bought a 32 gb card).
customer_reviews.author: Neil Collins

customer_reviews.title: a great starter for new and amateur photographers
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for 3 years and so far so good! I am happy with it's abilities, it matches my own capabilities. for anyone new to photography or hoping to have a little more control over the exposure, this is a great option. You still have all the features of a point and shoot, but a couple additional modes to allow more freedom. there are explanations for many of the settings to help you learn as you choose your options. And the camera is small enough (with an average size lens) to travel easily.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Great Professional Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is fantastic. The lens completes the camera. The picture and video quality is amazing. The sharpness in the ISO is also amazing. I have taken picture with ISO 1,600 and the picture looks phenomenal. Canon's JPEG processing is at its best. The only bad part of this camera is the continuous shooting; this is bad especially if you are taking pictures of sports. I have also notice that it tends to overexpose pictures in bright sunlight. Of course this can be fixed by using manual settings Pros Video and picture quality - 18 Megapixels! HDMI output Great and fast autofocus Cons Slow frame rate - (sports) Live view AF is laggy
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Salguero

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!!
customer_reviews.text: I made the big leap from an old Canon point&shoot to a DSLR last month. After much research I settled on the Rebel T3i (600D), and I have NOT regretted it. I bought several items to go with it (filters, additional lenses, gear bag, tripod, etc.), and I've taken a good quantity of shots with it already. I'm just scratching the surface of this thing, and I'm already blown away. There's a reason why this is the all-time best-selling entry-level DSLR. LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Mancini

customer_reviews.title: Great First DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I'll get right to the point. This is my first DSLR and I just love it! There's a bit of a learning curve, but not too difficult. The camera's easy to use and the pictures are incredible. The HD video will make you look like a pro. In fact, this thing makes taking great pictures unbelievably simple and at least for me, makes me look like a much better photographer than I am. If you have an eye on how to frame a picture, do it and the Canon T3i will do the rest. Want to take great pictures? Grab a T3i. It can make a cardboard box look great! 6 Stars!
customer_reviews.author: Greg de Mocskonyi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews of several DSLRs before buying this one because I was looking for the perfect first DSRL. I had some knowledge in photography but choosing one was very hard. The reviews, price, and features convinced me to acquire this one and I couldn't be happier. It has everything that I expected and more, great pictures; for the amateurs is very easy to use and very complete for the experienced. The only thing that I might recommend to anyone looking to buy this camera is that they should get the 18-135mm lens to have more versatility, I got it with the 18-55mm because of the cost but in the future I plan to upgrade the lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: Gift for my Daughter
customer_reviews.text: She wanted something for photographs and for blogging and posting videos. She had used (lborrowed from school) the same camera in her photography class, so had learned how to use it. And, since the school had purchased them for class, we figured they were pretty good and sturdy and easy enough to use and get very professional results. Have not been disappointed. You do need a memory card before you can use it, so be sure and buy one. She also has a tripod, which I would recommend getting. And a decent camera case would be a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: mrs. cravitz

customer_reviews.title: So far so great
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in two days. So far so great! It came with the body of the camera, a 18-55mm lense, three cables, charger and battery. I attached the pictures with everything that came in the box.
customer_reviews.author: PaoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: For video as good as the 60d and 7d
customer_reviews.text: I make video Documentary Films, I have worked with the Canon 7d, canon 60d and with the T3i. In video quality and functionality the 3 cameras provide me the same. In my personal opinion i like the t3i the most. The price is a good reason to buy this camera, but also this camera is smaller and lighter (maybe more fragile at the same time). But so far does the job and never cease to impress me. My recommendation is to spend the money in better lens and not in expensive cameras like the 7D ( FOR VIDEO PORPOISES)
customer_reviews.author: Video Production Co.

customer_reviews.title: ... camera over about a year ago and I absolutely love it! I was worried about ordering something so ...
customer_reviews.text: I received this camera over about a year ago and I absolutely love it! I was worried about ordering something so expensive, but it came in a perfect condition in its beautiful camera bag. Everything it came with was in great condition and I haven't had any trouble with it. I'm a beginner and I use it mostly for pictures for my blog and videos for youtube. It is very easy to figure out and there are lots of guides online to help people find out how to use features that aren't what they are used to. I received the camera in a normal shipping time and perfect condition, and it's still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this camera as a complete newbie and have been able to learn a lot without having to shell out a lot of money. I definitely think it is a great camera for beginners and if you're a casual picture taker, you may never need to upgrade! Favorite feature is the LCD screen that pops out and swivels. I recorded a self interview on it for school and could see myself and I have been able to pull out the screen and take high or low shots without having to actually get on the ground or be 7 feet tall. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Byer

customer_reviews.title: T3i a great intro dSLR
customer_reviews.text: I am not a camera expert, but rather,VERY USER FRIENDLY: The auto mode (or auto without flash, my favorite) is highly forgiving, taking fantastically sharp images, true to color. They look so clear that I feel I'm capturing as close to real life as I've ever seen before in a camera.This kind of goes without saying at this tier of camera, but the pictures are just amazing quality. Coming from the land of point-and-shoot, I'm pretty blown away. I love it and will do my best.
customer_reviews.author: khaled

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT SO MUCH!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the quality that this camera can pull-off. It was best deal I can ever have. Finally I am so happy to get a professional camera like this one. Thank you so much for a good deal, the camera is just new one with amazing price range. There is no scratch, no for what-so-ever! It is just perfectly secured and arrived !! Everything works fine, I am enjoying my life with my new camera. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Hyeon-I Son

customer_reviews.title: Wow.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is outstanding. I can't say more than what others have already said, but I will say this.. the day it came I unpackaged it, took a couple test pictures and said "I can't believe I waited this long to buy a decent camera". Said it outloud, and I live alone !! About 2 weeks after I purchased this camera, the T4i came out. I thought about returning this and ordering the T4i, but this one serves my purposes and then some. I love this camera, already have over 4,000 shots on it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Hoosiers

customer_reviews.title: Beginner
customer_reviews.text: This is my first DSLR. I. love. it. With the help from some online tutorials I have had lots of success in a short amount of time taking pictures that will be treasured. They are crisp and clear and easy to take. Since I am able to take lots of pictures quickly I don't have to worry about one of my kids blinking or not smiling right because I can usually have at least one good picture!
customer_reviews.author: MississippiQueen

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with this camera but consider a better lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera and I'm very happy with my purchase. The only thing I would do differently is that I would have just bought the body and then purchased a better lens. The kit lens the T3i comes with (EF-S 18-55 f/3.5-5.6 IS) is fine for a while but if you take a lot of pictures you might notice that it can give you soft pictures at the telephoto end. Especially if you have the lens wide open. Stopping it down does help a little. If your pictures will mostly be taken using the wide angle range with the lens not wide open then you might not notice many issues.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Everything I expected!
customer_reviews.text: Coming from an old rebel XTi, the T3i walks wonders around its older counterparts. The body feels better, tighter, and sturdier. The buttons and menu can be intimidating at first, but take your time to learn Canon's system because it's worth it! It takes beautiful photos and the ability to shoot in RAW is all you need to have professional photos without spending > $2K on a camera! I'd love to upgrade to a 5D or 7D someday but I don't know about that, so for now I'm sticking with the T3i (600D). Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: unclespoon

customer_reviews.title: In Love!
customer_reviews.text: I was very nervous about my camera upgrade and reached out to a few professional photographers who assured me that this was an excellent camera and also guided me on must haves! I love the camera even more than anticipated! I honestly was able to start taking pictures right away, right out of the box. I am not a professional more like a beginner. This is a great investment. I would caution you that the key is in good lens and a great flash as well!
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Solid camera
customer_reviews.text: Good camera for a start up video and photography enthusiast. The LCD viewfinder rotates and folds out allowing you to hold the camera at different angles while still seeing what you view. Simple and easy controls that you can quickly master. Crisp and responsive controls as well. Feels solid in your hand and has a rubber grip for you to hold the camera in your right hand.
customer_reviews.author: Jonesey90

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this 2 weeks now. This is my first DSLR and I am extremely happy with it. The features of the camera are easy to understand and use. I like how it has automatic, intermediate, and advanced modes. You can take great pictures right out of the box, and it offers more in-depth features as your skills grow. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone like me who felt they had graduated from point and shoot, and were ready to move to the next level without spending a lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: MM from IA

customer_reviews.title: T3i
customer_reviews.text: I come from the era of film cameras and hand held light meters. All this camera needs me for is to hold it, turn it on, and push a button. It takes excellent pictures in it's automatic modes but has many other features, some obscure, that can be accessed if you take the time to read the manual and perhaps buy a 3rd party book about the camera. Many of these features may not be useful to the average person but go through the manual anyway. You may find a feature you didn't know you need
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan E. Lepoff

customer_reviews.title: Great for photos but not video
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for the photo capability. It has been great. It probably has more features than I really could use. I also have a Canon HD video camera so I can compare the video feature. The T3i is not as good as the dedicated video camera. It cannot auto focus like my video camera and the audio is not recorded in stereo and is not as sensitive and it has limited zoom. Bottom line, if you expect to record great videos then buy a video camera. If you want great photos buy this T3i.
customer_reviews.author: tbirdvet

customer_reviews.title: super happy amateur
customer_reviews.text: Super happy as an enthusiastic amateur photographer. The no-bs review: it's been awesome for a first camera body, but I found its limits with 1. the slower rapid fire rates when attempting to capture action, and 2. you had better have a mono/tri pod or be braced and be shooting subjects that are immobile, because you're not going to get the low light performance of more expensive bodies...duh! Hehe! Basically, if you're not sure about dropping 1000.00+ on your first dslr, buy this, or buy it used/referb. Great learning experience/purchase and will be an awesome backup camera when I upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife for Xmas...she's had her eye on it for awhile. I tested it out before and now after that I have given it to her. NO issues or problems whatsoever. Gorgeous photos, smooth, beautiful Full HD video. SO many settings. Love how it can output to RAW for extended editing options with the photos. Just a joy to play with. Even the budding photographer can get some truly excellent results. Very much recommended. Plus that swiveling LCD is just the icing on the cake.
customer_reviews.author: The REAL Talk

customer_reviews.title: Excllent Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought during Holiday Season.Its a bit of investment ,but since it came with one lens included and a free 55-250mm Telephoto lens plus a Amazon case bundle,I could not resist it.It takes wonderful pictures,however you will need to study the included manual to get the most of it. If you love photography,want to invest money in it but is not a professional photographer,this is the camera for you.It is for tourists and people like me who like excellent photography without professional photography training.
customer_reviews.author: Somenath

customer_reviews.title: Purchased off the used list from levasseurjohn Couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.text: seller was wonderful wouldnt reccomend anyone else Camear is Flawless and was well kept by a high-school shutter count was nice and low. Seller is responsive and was very helpful with my questions. Using mine for astrophotography specifically 😎 Clear Skies ! Will update with pictures when I can.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, advanced features.
customer_reviews.text: The camera is very easy to use at first, but also has more advanced features. I've been using this camera for almost two years, and I'm consistently blown away. The day I got it I was impressed, now I'm even more impressed because this camera helps learn the technique and technical side and greatly improve images. Very Happy.
customer_reviews.author: K. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Great DSLR
customer_reviews.text: This camera has been awesome to have. It has been functioning perfectly ever since I got it. I used it to shoot the solar eclipse, and the photos were amazing. You will be getting what you expect from Canon. A great DSLR that shoots quality photos in jpeg or CR2 RAW. The video compression is high, but that is to be expected from any DSLR in this price range. Don't expect to do tons of contrast and saturation in film post-production, but sky is the limit in the photo RAW format.
customer_reviews.author: David Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife because she hates looking through tiny view finders. Now she has a very large preview screen and the pictures she has taken with it have been much better quality. You can also set up a grid on the view screen to help you with the rule of thirds. The memory chips that you put in this camera can be very large and taking all of your pictures in RAW format does not even put a ding in the amount of storage memory available.
customer_reviews.author: JSman

customer_reviews.title: First DSLR
customer_reviews.text: This is my first camera of anything remotely high end. The first few times I have taken it out have made me realize what good photos can look like with the right camera in your hands. Took it to the dog park earlier this week. Shot about 300 pictures and had a hard time deciding which one I liked the best. This camera is great, the settings let you have as much control as you want, so as your skill with the camera increases you can start controlling more and more of the individual elements that help make your photos stand out.
customer_reviews.author: piercewe

customer_reviews.title: A must have! User friendly!
customer_reviews.text: I waited so long to get a dslr bc I never knew which one to get. I had several people tell me that they had this one and that they loved it. I wasn't skeptical at all bc of how many photographers/friends recommended it; I just had to try it out. I absolutely love it!! I love the kit lens and I also got the f1.8 lens and OMG!!! Guys, this is the best price and the most axing camera if you are a beginner or even a pro (but you would already know that).
customer_reviews.author: Art Ed

customer_reviews.title: Awesome first DSLR, love it
customer_reviews.text: I really love this camera. It's my first DSLR and I use it for stills and video. I was hoping for slightly better low light image quality, but it's not magic- you need light to take pictures. So, I got myself a CowboyStudio lighting kit and have been taking magazine quality portraits. Learn to use the manual settings, you'll be happy you did. I mean that's the whole point of getting a nice camera, right? Too bad this model was discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: KetteringNate

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This camera exceeds my expectations. It is fast, farily quiet, and has lots of options to use or a really good automatic setting. This is definitely an upgrade from my last camera. I'm SO glad to be back in Canon gear! This camera is easy for my 6th , 5th, and 4th graders to use too. . . . . ONLY with my supervision! I am very impressed with the low light capabilities and the sharpness of the pictures. I use the tilt-able screen much more than I though. It is amazing how I don't have to crawl around as much on the ground to view what I'm trying to shoot! Bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: CellularStream on Amazon listed the camera as "Good" condition. I decided to take a chance since they had a money back guarantee. The camera that I received was in excellent condition, with only 5,000 shutter actuation. I am very pleased. I am the owner of 8 other Canon cameras. They make great still and video equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.P

customer_reviews.title: Didn't record a lot of pictures I thought I took.  Excellent image quality.
customer_reviews.text: The image quality is great. I could hardly believe the quality of the image I got in a dimly lit room. There is one terrible thing about this camera- a lot of photos I thought I took, heard the clicking, but didn't actually take a photo. I missed too many once in a lifetime moments because of this. There should also be a feature where the flash can be shut off while you're in other modes. For those reasons this camera was a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Gladding

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Did my research and boy am I happy with this bad boy. Super easy for a rookie like me to learn and even in the beginning had great pictures (no thanks to any skill on my part). Definitely glad I bought the lens separate -- ended up getting a Canon EF 50mm f/1.8 II Camera Lens. Much better then the lenses that come in the bundle. Also got a bigger memory card to hold even more pictures. I had read reviews about the battery life being so-so but it has been great for me. I have gone on a week vacation and took pictures every day and the battery lasted the whole time without charging.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Nelson

customer_reviews.title: This thing still looks great. I recommend picking up vintage lenses for it
customer_reviews.text: This thing still looks great. I recommend picking up vintage lenses for it. You can find them online for only $20 + shipping at times. You will need a converter, but it will give you a cinematic edge that even pro photographers don't take advantage of.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Viewfinder all out of whack, all blurry, cant adjust to fix...
customer_reviews.text: Since this was being used as an astro modified cam I didnt care for the viewfinder being messed up, but if I was going to be using for regular photography id be pissed!!! Buyers beware!!!
customer_reviews.author: Magitech

customer_reviews.title: This is a great camera for a beginner who wants to learn to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera for a beginner who wants to learn to take better pictures and shoot video. While the camera doesn’t have auto-focus in video mode like the newer DSLRs, the T3i is a great camera for filming and creating movies.
customer_reviews.author: Sole Proprietor

customer_reviews.title: Best camera for the money videos and photo!!
customer_reviews.text: I would say there isnt a camera that can match this ones quality video or photo wise for the price! I recently purchased mainly for video purposes and love it so far it is very easy to use and has presetting you just turn the dial to switch from video to photo modes that are preset I was scared it would be complicated to use but it really isnt its simple and very enjoyable and nothing beats dslr video quality! This video shows some video and photo quality
customer_reviews.author: Perry

customer_reviews.title: Works fine. Thanks
customer_reviews.text: It was in nicer condition then I thought it would be. Works fine. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera.
customer_reviews.text: I finally gave in and purchased this camera after years of using point and shoot. I'm glad I did. It's a very good camera for beginners like me going into dslr photography. I like the lcd display and the instructions on it. I own a canon point and shoot camera and they are quality products, but the pictures from the dslr are way better (night and day) I just started but so far it's been great. I'm still learning the camera. i would recommend getting the t3i book "From snapshots to great shots" if you purchase this camera.
customer_reviews.author: John Kenpo

customer_reviews.title: ... entry digital SLR this works very well and takes great picture. No complaints whatsoever other than I would ...
customer_reviews.text: For a cheaper entry digital SLR this works very well and takes great picture. No complaints whatsoever other than I would recommend getting a better lens when you have the money. Controls are easy to learn and can take the Magic Lantern OS which makes the camera much more versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I finally pulled the trigger and picked this guy up and I love it. There have been many
customer_reviews.text: FOR YEARS I desired a DSLR, and the closest I got was a Panasonic Lumix-LX3 (or whatever). I finally pulled the trigger and picked this guy up and I love it. There have been many, many reviews on this camera, and I do not think I can add anything else to the conversation. Just know that this is a very good camera and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: memory_tape

customer_reviews.title: Meeting all my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as a gift to my co-parent so she can use it to take lots of pictures of our amazing son. While I am not a camera expert I have owned a couple of good SLRs in the film era and take good pictures for an average owner. I am just so happy with how good the pictures are coming out. The lighting and the colors all look great to me. I don't use it for motion, only stills. My last great camera was a Canon A-1, and so far I like this camera just as much.
customer_reviews.author: Wood

customer_reviews.title: Solid entry point DSLR camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a great entry point camera for anyone looking to take more control over their pictures because of the ability to control exposure time, amount of light, focal point (what is in focus -v- what is not in focus). You can take great pictures and let the camera do all of the work, or take complete control over the shot. When you start adding additional lenses and other accessories, you can achieve very professional results. I haven't tried making any movies as of yet, but I am looking forward to that next.
customer_reviews.author: M. Redfern

customer_reviews.title: This is a great camera. I use it for portfolio work and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. I use it for portfolio work and my sister uses it for short videos. It does not come with a memory card, as most don't so you purchase that separately and they are fairly cheap. I didnt think it shot far away distances so well you would definitely need to buy a special lens. You would just think for 500+ you would get a little more... This is my first real camera purchase so we shall see...
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect but hissing
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! I product video commercials and the T3i comes products very high quality footage. You can select from 720 to 1080. I believe there is another high resolution but I'm producing a motion picture. The only downfall is this camera has a hissing sound, with or without using my lav mic. Regardless of all the tips online to remove the hissing, none works. I use Adobe Southbooth to remove..which is fine, but it's another extra step that seriously takes up my time.
customer_reviews.author: Kini

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my first DSLR, and I love it. I received it last week and spent the weekend taking great nature and landscape pictures. Easy to use and has good picture quality. Great camera for the price. Update - I've had this camera for several months now and have taken some truly amazing pictures with it. I recommend getting the Canon EFS 55-250mm f/4.5-5.6 IS II telephoto zoom lens for it. It really completes the package.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: great value for a great camera
customer_reviews.text: My first DSLR, having replaced a KODAK camera that I killed from taking way too many photos. With less than 3 days experience, I took some incredible photos in Israel with this camera. Did phenominal in low light, without flash. Would recommend getting the external flash if you intend to do a lot of low light photography as it will increase quality tenfold. Regardless, it creates some spectacular photos. With it being lightweight it was easy to take photos at water level in the Dead Sea. Be careful if you try that, because the minerals in the Dead Sea can cause damage to the metal.
customer_reviews.author: Esornad

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera!!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently decided to upgrade to a DSLR camerea. The canon t3i was the perfect choice for me, not low end, not high end, but everything I needed. I shoot a lot of animations and needed a remote triggering system. The shot quality is amazing. Easy to use. Canon has a simple and very effective tutorial that helps out with understanding all the bells and whistles of this camera. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great for Amateurs and Professionals
customer_reviews.text: Purchased my Rebel in 2013 and it has been one of the best purchases I've made. It has helped me evolve from an amateur photographer to a semi-professional. Once you learn how to master the manual settings and shoot in RAW, it is an extremely capable camera and can deliver professional quality results, even if it is on the lower end in terms of megapixel resolution among DSLR cameras these days. I'll be moving up to a higher-grade Canon DSLR within the next year or so, but will keep using this one for as long as I can.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and versatile.
customer_reviews.text: Third Rebel I own, very pleased with it. Specially, the remote flash firing and the swiveling lcd. This is the last Rebel I'll buy, next one will be a full frame. Vary reliable. I've used it for all my trips to every kind of weather, from icy winter in Scotland to scorching sun in Arizona to sandy beaches in Mexico and rainy days in Washington. More than 10.000 photos and battery is as good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Espinosa V

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: After having my Sony camera stolen, I searched a long time for something that was similar to it. I went with this camera even though the reviews were pretty mixed. I love it!!! I use it to take pictures of my kids and husband, both of which are action shots. I use it at family functions, in low light, outside...just everywhere. And it never fails me. Don't know how this would work for a professional photographer...but for a mother, wife and memory catcher, it works perfectly!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke M.

customer_reviews.title: More than a camera
customer_reviews.text: Very nice cam, is more than a photo shooting device, worked perfectly immediately after unboxing, not too difficult to use, many functionality and capabilities to be creative, the only reason I didn't give a 5 star is that it didn't come with a remote control, you have to order it separately ...
customer_reviews.author: Mikele M

customer_reviews.title: Awesome photos
customer_reviews.text: OK there are tons of reviews of this camera, so I'll keep it brief. Excellent photo quality! Controls... are OK, not as good as the 60D series, but it's cheaper. I do not like the fact that unlike my old t1i, the screen doesn't go off when you get your eye up to the viewfinder. The focus is slow and not so good when using the tilt screen in video mode. Despite those shortcomings I still like the camera and the low light capability, both photos and videos is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: G. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Image quality of a 7D in a much cheaper package
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It takes wonderful pictures with good high ISO performance. It feels good in the hands and with a battery grip it balances with bigger lenses well. It has almost all the features of the 60D minus the bigger viewfinder, faster shooting rate, and extra cross type focus points. I would make sure the smaller size of this camera fits your hand well. If it is too small then you might as well get the 60D instead of this version, but if you like the feel then save some money and get the T3i.
customer_reviews.author: Gamer Parents

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Def great for pictures, lots of features. main reason I bought it was cause this one unlike the T3, has manual control over video settings. BE AWARE if thats one reason you want or choose it.... make sure you have light. lots of fuzz will start to appear with 800 iso. i can't emphasize YOU NEED LIGHT COMING FROM EVERYWHERE! def a good for beginners or experts.
customer_reviews.author: benzido

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The camera is easy to use, fast, and takes great pictures. It's light weight and holds a charge. The auto focus had some trouble in low light on a distant shot, but the conditions were not great and I'm not sure what camera wouldn't have trouble focusing across a whole room in low light. Otherwise, ordinary shots in normal light are great. The camera is fast and I'm worried about timing the button press to be able to catch the smile moment.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Kosbau

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first DSLR camera. I have always had a point and shoot. But this camera takes some amazing pictures. It is a great beginners camera also because it explains everything to you itself :) The quality of the pictures is so much better than what I am used to taking. I had a Nikon Coolpix 6300 as my last camera. It takes good pics for what it is but this Rebel T3i shows me what I was missing :)
customer_reviews.author: Mo DeMarco

customer_reviews.title: Masterpiece
customer_reviews.text: I've taken photos that I'll cherish for the rest of time with this thing.. If you're looking to go DSLR, the t3i is a great buy since it's heavily discounted yet also isn't that much different than the t4, t5, or t6.
customer_reviews.author: CaptainNemo

customer_reviews.title: Rebel T3i
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my 20D that has been giving me error 99 for the past 6 months. It is smaller in size, but fits my hands well. All my accessories from the 20D fit and the learning curve is not all that great, making it just about as easy to use as the old 2005 model. I looked seriously at the T4i and T5i but could not justify the extra expense for the minute upgrades of the newer cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Willey

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of search trying to find a good camera with considerable price compared to 1000$ cameras until I found this one 3Ti. the photos I take with it are amazing. I mainly use it for family pictures. I am nor professional user however, this camera gave me a professional pictures. I feel happy whenever i see those pictures i feel as if i am professional photographer. definitely i recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Isam

customer_reviews.title: NIce Camera - Shaky Video
customer_reviews.text: The camera takes great pictures, but using it as a video camera is not always ideal (no stabilizing features). It's like filming with a video camera from the 80's, but you don't buy a camera like this for the video, you buy it for the pictures. The pictures are incredible and I'm still learning all the features that it offers. The quality is great (what you would expect from a Canon). I'm giving it a 5 star review for the pictures. If your buying it for the video I'd give it a 3.
customer_reviews.author: T. Massera

customer_reviews.title: I love this DSLR.
customer_reviews.text: I love my camera. I did a lot of research before buying. For the price and specifications of the camera, nothing could beat it. I just purchased the body and invested in a prime, as well as a nicer zoom and wide angle lens. I've taken thousands of pictures on this camera. I went on a road trip this summer, visiting a bunch of National Parks, and I loved how my pictures turned out. It's an easy to use camera, ideal for beginners, but even for those who like to shoot manually, like me. I'd recommend this over the T4i for the price. Nothing is different other than autofocus/mic input and I don't think that justifies the price difference.
customer_reviews.author: Stefani

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for promised free accessories that aren't
customer_reviews.text: The camera seems fine. I'm a newbie for DSLR cameras, but working through the manual, it looks like I'll be very happy with it. What I'm unhappy about is that Amazon promised a free camera bag and memory card, but they weren't included in the order. When I called customer support, all they would do is help me order them, for an additional $54. (They did offer to waive the delivery fee, but I'm a Prime member--for now--so that offer is meaningless.) This is the kind of misleading promise that erodes my trust in Amazon as a vendor.
customer_reviews.author: John R

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera! Love the sports feature for my kids ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera! Love the sports feature for my kids sports. Have lots of great pictures to share. Love the indoor shots too - clear. With the digital card I can takes hundreds of pictures and later sort through the keepers and the losers and not worry about wasting processing costs. Have lots more to learn about special features but until I learn it all I still get Great pictures!
customer_reviews.author: K. L. Handshoe

product_meta.title: Canon EOS Rebel T3i Digital SLR Camera Body Only (discontinued by manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Style:Body Only| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingCanon EOS Rebel T3i 18 MP CMOS Digital SLR Camera and DIGIC 4 Imaging. Comes with a battery and charger. The USB cable and an AVI accessories are included.EOS Rebel T3i Body, EF-S 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 IS Type II Lens, Eyecup Ef (not shown), Wide Strap EW-100DBIII, USB Interface Cable IFC-130U, AV Cable AVC-DC400ST, Battery Pack LP-E8, Battery Charger LC-E8E and EOS Digital Solution Disk and Instruction Manuals "Great Photography is Easy" Booklet and "Do More with Macro" Booklet (not shown).What's in the box: Canon EOS Rebel T3i Digital Camera (Body Only), LP-E8 Rechargeable Lithium-Ion Battery Pack (7.2V, 1120mAh), LC-E8E Battery Charger, Wide Strap, Interface Cable, AVC-DC400ST Stereo AV Cable, EOS Digital Solution Disk, Software Instruction Manual CD-ROM, Camera Instruction Manual and 1-Year Limited Warranty.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
High Resolution Still Capture
18.0 Megapixel CMOS (APS-C) sensor and DIGIC 4 Image Processor for high image quality and speed. 


The EOS Rebel T3i has an 18.0 Megapixel CMOS (Complementary Metal Oxide Semiconductor) sensor that captures images with exceptional clarity and tonal range and offers more than enough resolution for big enlargements or crops. This first-class sensor features many of the same new technologies as used by professional Canon cameras to maximize each pixel’s light-gathering efficiency. Its APS-C size sensor creates an effective 1.6x field of view (compared to 35mm format).

DIGIC 4 Image Processor
The Canon DIGIC 4 Image Processor dramatically speeds up the entire EOS Rebel T3i DSLR’s camera operations for intuitive operation and offers improvements in both fine detail and natural color reproduction. It works in concert with the EOS Rebel T3i DSLR’s CMOS Image Sensor to achieve phenomenal levels of performance in nearly any situation.


Amazing Results, No Matter the Light.
ISO 100 – 6400 (expandable to 12800) for shooting from bright to dim light. 
The EOS Rebel T3i features an expanded ISO range that makes shooting possible in situations previously unthinkable without flash. With an ISO rating up to 6400 (expandable to ISO 12800), along with the DIGIC 4 Image Processor's improved noise-reduction technology, creative possibilities abound. Combine the EOS Rebel T3i with one of Canon's EF or EF-S lenses with Optical Image Stabilizer and the shooting possibilities for both movies and stills expand even further. 




HD Dreams Come True. 
Improved EOS Full HD Movie mode with manual exposure control, expanded recording [1920 x 1080 Full HD video at frame rates of 30 (29.97), 24 (23.976) and 25.0 frames per second] with new Movie Digital zoom and Video Snapshot features for enhanced video shooting options. 
The EOS Rebel T3i does not just shoot video clips, it offers the enhanced ease-of-use, image quality, smooth frame rates and adaptive exposure compensation necessary in a professional video-making tool by boasting the most advanced EOS video capturing features to date: When Full HD (1920 x 1080) is set, you can use Movie Digital Zoom to magnify the center of the image by 3–10x while at the same time maintaining gorgeous Canon Full HD image quality. With the Video Snapshot feature, the EOS Rebel T3i DSLR will capture short video clips (of 2, 4 or 8 seconds) then combine them automatically into one video file as a snapshot or highlights “album.” With no editing needed after shooting, the compiled video is perfect for sharing online or displaying directly on an HDTV via the camera’s HDMI port. 

In addition to a number of different recording size and frame rate modes, the EOS Rebel T3i enables easy manual control of exposure, focus and Live View features and even allows for in-camera editing. The large CMOS sensor and compatibility with over 60 lenses provide a wealth of depth-of-field options. And it’s all as easy as the press of a button — the EOS Rebel T3i has a dedicated Live View/Movie Recording start/stop button that gets the shooting started fast. 



Three Recording Sizes 
Full HD Video is captured at 1920 x 1080 resolution at 30p (29.97), 24p (23.976) or 25p frames per second, for up to 4GB per clip. Video are saved as .MOV files and can be viewed in Full HD with HDMI output. Other recording sizes include HD at 1280 x 720 (50p/60p (59.94) fps) or SD/VGA at 640 x 480 (30p (29.97) and 25p fps). 

Low Angles or High, a Big Vari-angle LCD Captures All the Details. 
Vari-angle 3.0-inch Clear View LCD monitor (3:2) for shooting at high or low angles and 1,040,000-dot VGA with reflection reduction using multi coating and high-transparency materials for bright and clear viewing. 
The EOS Rebel T3i features a bright, high resolution, flip-out Vari-angle 3.0-inch Clear View LCD monitor for shooting at a variety of angles. By simply rotating the monitor, you can hold the camera directly overhead for above-the-crowd shots at concerts, or hold the camera at a low angle for kids and pets. By rotating the LCD monitor fully, the EOS Rebel T3i becomes the ideal camera for self-portraits. The EOS Rebel T3i freely enables easy angle adjustments even if the camera is mounted on a tripod or has a battery grip attached.

Model used is not EOS Rebel T3i and is used to illustrate vari-angle feature only.

With 1,040,000 (dots/VGA) pixels for spectacular detail, the advanced, smudge-resistant monitor includes high transparency materials plus anti-reflective and water-repellant coatings to provide clear and bright viewing. Superb for reviewing, editing and deleting photos or composing new images in Live View function, the Vari-angle Clear View LCD monitor is also the perfect means for accessing camera settings like ISO, metering modes, AF Point selection, the horizontal Electronic Level and flash options. 


Automatic Scene Analysis for Standout Color. 
New Scene Intelligent Auto mode and Picture Style Auto incorporating the new EOS Scene Detection System to capture beautiful scenes with ease. 
The EOS Rebel T3i DSLR’s new Scene Intelligent Auto mode unites five Canon digital camera technologies – the new Picture Style Auto, plus Automatic Lighting Optimizer, Automatic White Balance, Autofocus, and Automatic Exposure –into a powerful new feature for photographers. Using the advanced EOS Scene Detection System, the camera automatically analyzes the image, taking into account faces, colors, brightness, movement and contrast. Scene Intelligent Auto then chooses the enhancing features to deliver maximum impact. Blues and greens are more vivid, “hot” colors are more fiery, and skin tones are smooth and truer to life. 

Intelligent Scene Analysis for Superb Exposure. 
Enhanced metering with a 63-zone, Dual-layer metering system for accurate metering between exposures, and 9-point AF system utilizing a high precision, f/2.8 cross-type center point. 
The EOS Rebel T3i features a sophisticated, 63-zone Dual-layer sensor designed to complement the 9-point AF system. By taking into account the color and luminosity surrounding chosen AF points, this system delivers an advanced level of accuracy for better results even in difficult lighting situations. Since the metering sensor has a color measurement function, exposure errors and focus errors caused by different light sources are minimized; the EOS Rebel T3i gives stable exposure from shot to shot in situations where light changes, such as in a theater or concert hall. This makes the EOS Rebel T3i ideal for scenes with extreme difference in brightness such as brightly lit scenes or backlit scenes; the camera balances exposure of the main subject at the background, and exposures are not overly influenced by bright areas in the shot. Since the EOS Rebel T3i provides high-speed X-sync (“X-sync” means the fastest shutter speed that can synchronize with a flash burst at the moment the shutter is fully released) up to 1/200 sec., the range of photographic expression is dramatically increased, allowing the EOS Rebel T3i to be used with confidence in bright scenes or dim.

 
63-zone Metering System

Make Your Images As You See Them. 
Express your creativity with advanced imaging features like Basic+ function, Multi-Aspect function and Creative Filters.
Basic+ is a new creative imaging feature that makes it easy to create the image effects you want. It can be set with the Quick Control screen in Basic Zone modes. Basic+ provides two options:

Shoot by ambience selection
Based on the Picture Style and its parameters (sharpness, contrast, saturation, and color tone), the exposure compensation and white balance correction are adjusted to attain the selected ambience. You can also can also select the strength of the ambience effect.

Shoot by lighting or scene type
Although the actual parameter set is the white balance, the settings are expressed in more understandable terms.

The Multi-Aspect Function of the EOS Rebel T3i lets you express an image in one of three ways by matching the aspect ratio to each scene. In addition to the camera’s standard 3:2 ration, the Multi-Aspect Function includes a 1:1 ratio that creates the sensation that the viewer's gaze is focusing upon the center of the image. At the 4:3 ratio, you get nearly the same aspect ratio as a regular TV or a 4:3 computer display. The 16:9 aspect ratio provides a wide look, much the same as HDTV.

The EOS Rebel T3i incorporates five in-camera Creative Filters so you can artistically manipulate scenes without the aid of an outside computer. Soft Focus lends a dreamy, romantic aspect, while Grainy Black and White gives a dramatically gritty, hard-bitten look. Miniature Effect creates an illusion in which expansive subjects are seemingly reduced to doll-house-like proportions, and Toy Camera Effect recreates the colors and softness rendered by cameras with a plastic lens, an effect often sought after by art photographers. Fish Eye Effect mimics the “Fisheye” lenses that are favorites of professional photographers for their quirky, convex perspective. 


Never Miss a Moment. 
3.7 fps continuous shooting up to approximately 34 JPEGs or approximately 6 RAW. 
The EOS Rebel T3i can shoot up to 3.7 frames per second (fps) for up to approximately 6 consecutive RAW files or approximately 34 full-resolution JPEGs. Shooting at speeds of up to 1/4000 sec., the EOS Rebel T3i can capture even rapidly-unfolding scenes with ease. 




Photography Made Truly Easy. 
New Feature Guide offers short descriptions of each function and Quick Control screen for easy operation. 
The Canon EOS Rebel T3i DSLR demystifies great photography by including an in-camera Feature Guide. Appearing on the camera’s LCD, the Feature Guide displays a simple description or advice for the respective function. It is displayed in each shooting mode, during Mode Dial operations, and for Quick Control screen functions (during normal shooting, Live View shooting, movie shooting, and playback). The Feature Guide appears automatically during Mode Dial operations and when a function is selected on the Quick Control screen. 


Flexible Storage with Memory Cards. 
Compatibility with SD/SDHC/SDXC memory cards. 
The EOS Rebel T3i uses popular SD, SDHC and SDXC memory cards. Compact, inexpensive and available in increasingly large capacities, SD, SDHC and SDXC memory cards are a perfect complement to the EOS Rebel T3i DSLR’s compact and lightweight body design. 

Additionally, the EOS Rebel T3i is compatible with Eye-Fi* SD cards, which are outfitted with a Wi-Fi transmitter (IEEE 802.11b/g) and an internal antenna for wireless, high-speed transfer of images. With an Eye-Fi card installed, the EOS Rebel EOS Rebel T3i can display the Eye-Fi’s connection status and error notes with ease, for fully functional wireless uploading of images directly from the camera.

*Canon cameras are not guaranteed to support Eye-Fi card functions, including wireless transfer. In case of an issue with the Eye-Fi card, please consult with the card manufacturer. The use of Eye-Fi cards may not be available outside the United States and Canada; please contact the card manufacturer for territory availability.


The Best Optics for the Best Images. 
Compatible with the full line of Canon EF and EF-S lenses. 
EF Lenses
The EOS Rebel T3i is compatible with all Canon lenses in the EF lineup, including compact and lightweight EF-S lenses, ranging from ultra-wide angle to super telephoto lenses. Canon lenses employ advanced optical expertise and micron-precision engineering to deliver outstanding performance and deliver beautiful results. Special technologies like the Canon Image Stabilizer technology in select lenses helps to minimize the effect of camera shake, effectively adding up to four stops of light. With a dizzying array of lenses perfect for travel, sports, still life and everything in between, photographers can truly maximize the quality and performance of their EOS Rebel T3i with superlative Canon optics.



Flash Photography
With a flash sync speed of 1/200 of a second, the EOS Rebel T3i also features the acclaimed E-TTL II flash metering system. With any of the flashes in the EX Speedlite line, E-TTL II provides reliable flash output whether shooting fill-in flash pictures in sunlight, or using flash in total darkness. With E-TTL II, the exact same 35-zone metering sensor used for measuring ambient light is also used for flash metering — giving even finer metering command of the image area. If you prefer a broader area for flash metering, there’s a menu setting to change to “Average” flash metering — where the entire 35-zone area is measured evenly for flash exposure. Additionally, the EOS Rebel T3i has a Speedlite transmitter built-in for convenient, full-featured wireless control of EX-series Speedlite flashes set as slave units.

The Canon Speedlite 430EX II is the ideal step-up accessory for powerful flash shooting with the EOS Rebel T3i. It has excellent flash power (maximum guide number of 141 ft./43m at ISO 100), and is the perfect way to get great flash pictures when you can't get right up to the subject. The 430EX II is also great for bounce flash, with its tilting and swiveling flash head. It automatically zooms the flash head to cover lenses ranging from 16mm up to 105mm or longer with the EOS Rebel T3i. Of course, it works with the camera to provide full E-TTL II automatic flash exposure. And the 430EX II has a powerful AF-assist beam, which allows the camera to autofocus even in total darkness on subjects as far as 32 ft. from the camera.

 
Speedlite 430EX II
